Row.Text: Rising waters overflow the banks of the river and spill into the land beyond.
Surging, murky water rushes over the land around the river during an intense flood.
The river bursts its banks, and rising water covers the land for miles around. Not for a thousand years has the river flooded to such an extent!
People and animals view the rising column of ash from Kilimanjaro from miles around, and wonder at the Earth’s fury.
Kilimanjaro roars, and a plume of smoke and ash jets into the sky, as people and animals flee in terror!
People must go far out of their way to avoid the huge plume of ash that erupts from Eyjafjallajökull.
Eyjafjallajökull tears open a rift in the earth, as if the goddess Hel herself were escaping from the netherworld!
Citizens scream in terror and flee towards safety as the pyroclastic wave crashes down the flanks of Vesuvius!
People gaze skyward in concern, watching smoke rise from a once-quiet volcano.
People living near the volcano flee as lava and ash blankets the surrounding land.
People flee in terror as pyroclastic flows lash the slopes of the volcano and jets of smoke pour into the sky!
This is the first land that floods when sea levels rise.
This land will flood when sea levels rise a second time.
This will be the last land affected by rising sea levels.
Storms and Floods no longer improve fertility.
Storms and Droughts passing over a tile begin to remove bonus fertility added earlier in the game.
Storms and Droughts passing over a tile regularly remove bonus fertility added earlier in the game.
Storms and Droughts passing over a tile quite often remove bonus fertility added earlier in the game.
An icy wind sweeps blanketing snow across the landscape, as living creatures huddle in their dens.
The howling wind and lashing snow turn sky and land white. Familiar forms disappear beneath frozen mounds.
The sun is an angry orange disc in a hazy sky as people scurry about their business, cloth wrapped around noses and mouths.
From far off people see the approaching wall of driven sand, and scatter to seek safety before the scouring wind!
A tornado slowly descends from a summer storm, and people seek refuge.
A fast-moving line of storms gallop across the darkening summer sky, with tornadoes ominously forming beneath.
Pelting rain and a howling gale mark the arrival of a mighty hurricane.
The wind screams, the torrents of rain fall, and the waves drive inexorably ashore. Little can stand where this hurricane passes!
Locusts whirr and dust stirs in the hot wind. The land is parched by drought.
A merciless sun beats down on the drought-stricken and withered earth. No rain has fallen, and the skies promise no relief.

Engineers in the Nuclear Power Plant control room work feverishly to contain a spreading leak. They have already prevented a worse outcome, but the situation is still serious.
Alarms sound at the Nuclear Power Plant! Jets of steam rise from cracks in the reactor and dosimeters click and whir as radiation blankets the area.
An ominous explosion thunders, and a dark plume rises above the Nuclear Power Plant. One by one, the wailing of sirens becomes a shrieking chorus, as hellish lumps of burning fuel begin to rain down.
